articles.content: In the three years since ChatGPT‚Äôs explosive debut , OpenAI‚Äôs technology has upended a remarkable range of everyday activities at home, at work, in schools‚Äîanywhere people have a browser open or a phone out, which is everywhere. Now OpenAI is making an explicit play for scientists. In October, the firm announced that it had launched a whole new team, called OpenAI for Science, dedicated to exploring how its large language models could help scientists and tweaking its tools to support them. articles.author: Will Douglas Heaven

articles.title: Apple's AirTag 2 is easier to find thanks to new chip
articles.description: This is the first major upgrade since Apple introduced AirTags five years ago.
articles.content: Apple is introducing a new version of its AirTag tracking device‚Äîsimply dubbed "the new AirTag"‚Äîand claims it offers substantial improvements thanks to a new Bluetooth chip. The original AirTag came out five years ago now, and it became popular in a variety of contexts. There were some problems, though‚Äîthere was real concern about unwanted tracking and stalking with the devices, based on real stories of it being used for that. The company gradually introduced new features and protections against
articles.author: Samuel Axon

articles.description: TikTok's newly formed US entity is off to a very bumpy start. As the app continues to face technical issues affecting the recommendation algorithm, view counts and other features, TikTok is also seeing a wave of frustrated users uninstalling it, according to new data. Analytics firm Sensor Tower, wh
articles.content: TikTok's newly formed US entity is off to a very bumpy start. As the app continues to face technical issues affecting the recommendation algorithm, view counts and other features, TikTok is also seeing a wave of frustrated users uninstalling it, according to new data. Analytics firm Sensor Tower, which tracks downloads and other app store-related metrics, told CNBC that there has been a 150 percent rise in uninstalls of the TikTok app in the United States compared with the last three months. An
articles.author: Karissa Bell

articles.title: Strava and Komoot finally bring offline maps to Apple Watch
articles.description: Strava and Komoot - two of the most popular apps for cyclists, hikers, and runners - are each bringing offline maps to the Apple Watch, ending a major source of frustration for many. Now you can easily see routes and record your workouts all in your preferred app, without having to bring along a rel
articles.content: Komoot offers more features to all users for free, including turn-by-turn navigation. | Image: Komoot Strava and Komoot - two of the most popular apps for cyclists, hikers, and runners - are each bringing offline maps to the Apple Watch, ending a major source of frustration for many. Now you can easily see routes and record your workouts all in your preferred app, without having to bring along a relatively heavy and cumbersome iPhone. Strava says the offline maps are only available to subscriber
articles.author: Thomas Ricker

articles.title: OpenAI spills technical details about how its AI coding agent works
articles.description: Unusually detailed post explains how OpenAI handles the Codex agent loop.
articles.content: On Friday, OpenAI engineer Michael Bolin published a detailed technical breakdown of how the company's Codex CLI coding agent works internally, offering developers insight into AI coding tools that can write code, run tests, and fix bugs with human supervision. It complements our article in December on how AI agents work by filling in technical details on how OpenAI implements its "agentic loop." AI coding agents are having something of a "ChatGPT moment," where Claude Code with Opus 4.5 and Cod

articles.content: Bridget McCormack is used to correcting judges' work. articles.content: Before JDK 1.2 Java developers mainly used: Arrays (fixed size, rigid) Legacy classes like Vector and Hashtable Problems: No standard structure Inconsistent design Hard to maintain and extend JDK 1.2 ‚Äî COLLECTIONS FRAMEWORK Java introduced the Collections Framework to: Standardize data storage Provide reusable data structures Improve consistency and flexibility ==================================================== üå± ITERABLE (ROOT FOR TRAVERSAL) Introduced: JDK 1.5 Package java.lang Purpose: All

articles.title: Why has Microsoft been routing example.com traffic to a company in Japan?
articles.description: Company's autodiscover caused users' test credentials to be sent outside Microsoft networks.
articles.content: From the Department of Bizarre Anomalies: Microsoft has suppressed an unexplained anomaly on its network that was routing traffic destined to example.com‚Äîa domain reserved for testing purposes‚Äîto a maker of electronics cables located in Japan. Under the RFC2606 ‚Äîan official standard maintained by the Internet Engineering Task Force‚Äîexample.com isn't obtainable by any party. Instead it resolves to IP addresses assigned to Internet Assiged Names Authority. The designation is intended to prevent th
articles.author: Dan Goodin
